text:
The Polo Grounds viewed westward from the outfield and showing same, nestling' at the foot of Coogan's Bluff. Atop the latter and west of what is today Edgecombe Ave. are buildings extending between West 157th (left) and 162nd (right) Streets. The Jumel Mansion is at the last point and partially obscured by the trees. Note the two modes of transportation shown and the popularity of this sport with the fair sex.

1889.

Brown Brothers.
title: Manhattan: Polo grounds.

text:
The Polo Grounds viewed northwestward from the bleachers and showing the field and grandstand at the foot of Coogan's Bluff. Atop the latter and west of what is today Edgecombe Ave. appear structures between West 158th (left) and 162nd (right) Streets; the Jumel Mansion being at the latter extremity.

About 1889.

International Photos Inc.
title: Manhattan: Polo grounds.

text:
The Polo Grounds on the Harlem River at about 158th Street, viewed north eastward from Coogan's Bluff. Buildings in the background are on the Bronx shore.

May 1911

George L. Balgue
title: Manhattan: Polo grounds.

text:
1. The Polo Grounds viewed in an eastward direction from a point in Highbridge Park at the foot of West 158th Street. In the background is the Harlem River and beyond same the Borough of the Bronx.

June 1924.

P. L. Sperr.

2. Polo Grounds. Neg. A-129 P.L. Sperr June 29, 1941
title: Manhattan: Polo grounds.

text:
1. The Polo Grounds viewed in an eastward direction from a point in Highbridge Park at the foot of West 158th Street. In the background is the Harlem River and beyond same the Borough of the Bronx.

June 1924.

P. L. Sperr.

2. Polo Grounds. Neg. A-129 P.L. Sperr June 29, 1941
title: Manhattan: Polo grounds.

text:
The Polo Grounds viewed southward from a point in Highbridge Park; near the Jumel Mansion and across the southwestern corner of the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. yards. On the left appears the Harlem River and the Bronx shore. The foreground area was formerly known as Coogan's Bluff with the Harlem Speedway at its foot.

About 1930.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Polo grounds.
